intro: Noltia tricolor, commonly known as the three-color buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of North America. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets, and its bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils such as along streambanks and in woodland edges. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like the buttercup and the crowfoot. Noltia tricolor is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
